introduction: A new president and 137 members of the National Assembly (legislature) will be elected for a four-year term. President Daniel Noboa and left-leaning Luisa González, who came second in the 2023 snap elections, are the likely front runners in the presidential race, which is set to be highly competitive and uncertain. Despite modest agenda results during his government, Noboa will likely be re-elected by a tight margin in a run-off on 13 April.
The third summit of its kind will focus on public interest AI; the future of work; innovation and culture; trust in AI; and global AI governance. It will be held in Paris (France).

Terrorism threats and propaganda can be elevated in some regions during Ramadan. In addition, protests have occurred in Muslim-majority countries during Ramadan and the celebration of Eid al-Fitr (marking the end of Ramadan). Ramadan could also trigger anti-Muslim hate crimes or sentiment in some non-Muslim majority countries. The Middle East conflicts will likely drive increased threats during Ramadan in 2025.
The day commemorates the 1985 killings of two brothers by the police. Violent protests in Santiago and other cities traditionally occur on the day.

Threats against Jewish communities, people and assets are likely to be elevated in some countries during the Passover religious holiday. Islamist extremist groups have planned or conducted attacks targeting Passover celebrations in Israel. The Israel-Hamas conflict is likely to increase the intent of Islamist and right-wing extremists to target Jewish communities and religious assets during Passover.
The Easter religious holiday is not generally associated with elevated violent extremist threats, though attacks have targeted religious services in some countries (notably in Sri Lanka in 2019).

May Day is typically celebrated by socialist and communist political movements and is a global day of action for anti-capitalist, anarchist and other left-wing activists. May Day protests in parts of Europe and North America involve vandalism, property damage and clashes with law enforcement and right-wing counter-demonstrators.

All 318 seats in the House of Representatives (lower house) and 12 of the 24 seats in the Senate (upper house) will be contested. Local elections will also be held for the executive and legislative branches.

Palestinians commemorate Nakba (“catastrophe”) – a term they use to refer to when more than 700,000 Arabs fled or were expelled during the creation of Israel. The Middle East conflicts will drive higher turnouts at related protests globally.

event: Deadline for a Global Pandemic Treaty
introduction: WHO member states have extended the mandate of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Body, established in December 2021, to finish its work to negotiate a Global Pandemic Treaty.
Canada will host the G7 Leaders Summit in Kananaskis (Alberta).
The Netherlands for the first time will host the NATO Summit. It will take place in The Hague.
Sofia is expected to adopt the euro and become the 21st eurozone member. In July 2024, the Bulgarian parliament passed the relevant bill on its first reading.

event: First crewed mission to the Moon since 1972
introduction: Artemis II, the first crewed mission to the Moon since 1972 and second mission of the Artemis Program, is scheduled to launch no earlier than September 2025.
The far right is expected to showcase its growing support during the national elections. It made significant gains in three state elections in 2024.
